author: @todonoticias
title: Una joven mostr√≥ c√≥mo una clienta le pidi√≥ un descuento y la amenaz√≥ cuando la mand√≥ a "buscar un laburito" | TN
text:
En el mundo de las compras online , las sorpresas est√°n a la orden del d√≠a. Pero lo que vivi√≥ una vendedora con una clienta que quer√≠a pagar en cuotas de una manera ins√≥lita, dej√≥ a todos boquiabiertos.
Todo comenz√≥ de manera normal, cuando la joven recibi√≥ un mensaje para una compra online. Sin embargo, el primer cruce de palabras fue un poco inc√≥modo por la forma en la que la clienta exig√≠a los precios.
Le√© tambi√©n: Le ofrecieron un trabajo de 45 hs semanales por $550.000 y su respuesta se volvi√≥ viral
La clienta le pidi√≥ un descuento por su compra. (Foto: captura video) Despu√©s de recibir toda la informaci√≥n que solicit√≥, le pidi√≥ un descuento a la emprendedora. Tras algunas idas y vueltas, la joven accede a hacerle un 10% de descuento , lo que fue recibido con un comentario sarc√°stico: ‚ÄúQu√© miseria‚Äù.
Ya con un ambiente bastante tenso, la clienta sigui√≥ exigiendo cosas: ‚Äú Te voy pagando mes por mes. Vos me das las cosas y yo te giro ‚Äù. Esta fue la propuesta que dej√≥ a la vendedora sin palabras.
La vendedora, sorprendida, intent√≥ explicarle que al no conocerla y no tener cierta confianza, no iba a aceptar este tipo de medio de pago.
La mujer la mand√≥ a buscar trabajo luego de un fuerte cruce. (Foto: captura video) Esto enoj√≥ a la clienta que se decidi√≥ por insultarla. ‚Äú Te dejo el link para que busques un laburito o algo. Se ve que est√°s bastante aburrida ‚Äù.
Le√© tambi√©n: Hizo un pedido de stickers, le mandaron un par de regalo y realiz√≥ un ins√≥lito reclamo: ‚ÄúQuiero mi plata‚Äù
Esta ins√≥lita conversaci√≥n se viraliz√≥ r√°pidamente en redes sociales donde miles de personas cuestionaron el accionar de la clienta. ‚ÄúAm√©, le mandaba link para tener laburo JAJA‚Äù, ‚ÄúCuando termine la √∫ltima cuota y este 100% saldado, le das la ropa‚Äù, ‚ÄúM√°s que un laburo deber√≠a buscar una escuela‚Äù, fueron algunos de los comentarios.

author: Zach Jewell
title: ‚ÄòEveryone Over There Is A Terrorist‚Äô: Israeli Woman Abducted By Hamas, Held Hostage By Family In Gaza Opens Up About Weeks-Long Captivity | The Daily Wire
text: Streaming Now The decade's most triggering comedy [Mia Schem](https://www.dailywire.com/news/biden-admin-blasts-hamas-propaganda-after-terrorists-release-first-hostage-video-showing-young-woman-under-duress), a 21-year-old Israeli-French woman who was abducted by Hamas on October 7, opened up about the ‚Äúholocaust‚Äù she experienced during her 54 days in captivity in Gaza, saying, ‚ÄúEveryone over there is a terrorist.‚Äù After being kidnapped by Hamas terrorists from a music festival in southern Israel during the terrorist group‚Äôs brutal attack on Israel, Schem said she was held captive by a family in Gaza who were working with the terrorist organization. She was freed as part of a temporary ceasefire between Israel and Hamas last month, and the 21-year-old tattoo artist is now revealing more about her terrifying experience as a Hamas hostage. ‚ÄúIt was important to me to relay the truth about the nature of the people who live in Gaza, who they are truly are and what I experienced there,‚Äù Schem said in a clip of an interview with Channel 13, the New York Post [reported](https://nypost.com/2023/12/28/news/freed-hostage-mia-schem-i-went-through-a-holocaust-as-a-hamas-captive/). ‚ÄúIt was important to you that the world understands what?‚Äù journalist Lior Veroslavsk asked her. ‚ÄúThat I went through a holocaust,‚Äù Schem replied. ‚ÄúEveryone over there is a terrorist.‚Äù Former hostage Mia Schem: "I went through a Holocaust" [pic.twitter.com/FsTGSd6OX7] ‚Äî Aviva Klompas (@AvivaKlompas) [December 28, 2023] ‚ÄúEntire families are in the service of Hamas,‚Äù she added. ‚ÄúSuddenly I realized that I‚Äôm with a family. Suddenly I‚Äôm asking myself questions: Why am I in some family‚Äôs home? Why are there kids here? Why is there a wife?‚Äù Hamas has [ruled](https://apnews.com/article/hamas-gaza-palestinian-authority-israel-war-ed7018dbaae09b81513daf3bda38109a) the Gaza Strip for over 15 years with strong support from the Palestinian people living there. According to a recent poll, around [60% of the Palestinians](https://www.dailywire.com/news/palestinians-overwhelmingly-support-hamas-terror-attacks-but-deny-hamas-war-crimes-palestinian-poll) in Gaza [supported](https://www.jpost.com/arab-israeli-conflict/article-773791) Hamas‚Äô attack on Israel and only 21% in Gaza said they opposed the terrorist attack. Shortly after she was taken hostage by Hamas, Schem appeared in a video clip posted to Telegram by the terrorists. In the video, Schem spoke to the camera and pleaded for her safe return home, claiming Hamas was taking care of her. The video also showed a large scar on her arm, and she said that her captors operated on her injured arm for three hours after taking her to the Gaza Strip. ‚ÄúI was [at] a party. I was badly injured in my arm. They took me to Gaza. They performed a 3-hour surgery to my arm. They took care of me, treated me, provided medicine to me. Everything is fine,‚Äù Schem said before pleading for her release. [CLICK HERE TO GET THE DAILYWIRE+ APP](https://onelink.to/dwapp) ‚ÄúI am just asking them to return me home as soon as possible,‚Äù she continued. ‚ÄúTo my family, father, mother, and siblings. Please, get us out of here as soon as you can.‚Äù The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) posted a [statement](https://twitter.com/IDF/status/1714028835916652675) about Schem‚Äôs hostage video, saying Hamas attempts to ‚Äúportray themselves as human,e‚Äù but in reality ‚Äúare a horrific terrorist organization responsible for the murder and abduction of babies, children, men, women and the elderly.‚Äù Hamas Islamist terrorists have released video of an injured Israeli hostage Mia Schem from Gaza. IDF Statement üëá Last week, Mia Schem's family was informed by IDF officials that Mia had been adbucted. IDF representatives are in continuous contact with the family. The IDF is‚Ä¶ [pic.twitter.com/nHG587QtF4] ‚Äî Aditya Raj Kaul (@AdityaRajKaul) [October 16, 2023]
